intro: Dischidia ridleyana, commonly known as the climbing fig or the orchid fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is a trailing or climbing plant characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Dischidia ridleyana is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in warm, humid environments. It is also notable for its ability to form aerial roots, which help it climb and attach to surfaces.
